fields.caption: A black bear, which has been sedated, and her cub in a den in Massachusetts.
A black bear with a salmon in Alaska. A bear would take some time to build up to a meal this large after hibernation, initially noshing on insects and plants instead.
Unlike many insects, honey bees stay somewhat abuzz during the winter.
A little brown bat roosting on tree bark.
An Arctic ground squirrel in Alaska’s Denali National Park.
